json.text: 30 last minute DIY Halloween Costumes! Clarissa May clarissamay09 Last Minute Halloween Costume
Ideas, Minnie mouse costume, unicorn, hippie, ladybug, princess, tennis player, Greek goddess,
cat, leopard, biker chick, Tris from Divergent, belly dancer, movie star, finding nemo girl
Darla, Miranda Sings, Pippi longstockings, painter, Regina George from Mean Girl, ballerina,
dancer, flapper girl, Rosie the Riveter, little red riding hood, vampire, cowgirl, scarecrow,
error 404 costume, witch, minion, and baby costume, Clarissa May, 30 Last Minute DIY
Halloween Costumes
Hey guys, it's Clarissa, and today I have a very very exciting video for you guys which
is 30 Last Minute Halloween costumes that you can really easily throw together out of
stuff that you already have in your wardrobe, and also a few DIY accessories that you can
put together yourself really really quickly! Also, before we get started, I have a super
exciting giveaway where I'm giving away the I Am Juicy Couture perfume which is amazing,
and also this adorable lacey coral romper right here which is just SO cute, I am absolutely
in love with it, and also this pair of lacey shorts which are adorable, and then this cheetah
print purse... I love cheetah print, obviously I'm wearing cat ears with cheetah print on
them right now. So if you guys want to be able to enter to win all of these awesome
prizes, then all you have to do is make sure that you're subscribed to my channel here
on Youtube, and then also comment down below which of costume ideas was your favorite,
and then also for major bonus points, make sure you're following me on Instagram and
Twitter, and that's it, that's all that you have to do to enter this giveaway, so good
luck to all of you guys, and without further ado, let's get into the video!
witch, minion, and baby costume
This first costume idea is an adorable ladybug, and for this you'll just need to wear a red
outfit, then cut some paper ladybug spots to stick on to your outfit, and you can make
yourself a pair of antanae by just hot-gluing two pom poms onto a pipe cleaner, then gluing
the pipe cleaner on to  a headband!
To be a hippie, you just need some flared pants, a tie die shirt or a crop top, some
peace-sign jewelry, a pair of sunglasses, and a flowercrown!
To turn yourself into a biker chick for halloween, all you need is a black outfit with a leather
jacket, and maybe some temporary tattoos if you want to look super cool.
For a super cute unicorn, you just need a colorful outfit, a fluffy skirt, and a unicorn
horn that you can make by just rolling up a piece of paper, adding some washi tape if
you want, then stringing elastic through it so it's like a headband! Also, if you use
an all pink and white outfit, you can be the fluffy unicorn from Dispicable me!
To turn yourself into a cowgirl, all you need a flannel shirt, some jeans, a cowboy hat,
and cowboy boots!
To be minnie mouse, you just need a red and black outfit and a pair of mouse ears, and
if you have a polka-dotted red outfit, that's even better!
For the detective, all you need is a trench coat, a magnifying glass, a hat if you want,
and a pair of glasses or sunglasses!
For the tennis player, all you need is a fitness outfit like a sports bra and a tennis skirt
or leggings, and a tennis racket!
To turn yourself into Rosie the Riveter, all you need is a denim shirt, a pair of jeans,
some boots, and a red bandana with your hair in an updo!
To turn yourself into a minion, you just need a yellow top, overalls or denim shorts with
suspenders, and a yellow minion hat!
To be little red riding hood, you just need a black dress, a basket, and a red coat or
cape!
A cat is probably the easiest costume ever... all you need is a pair of cat ears, a tail,
and whatever outfit you want, and if you want to make it more interesting, you can also
wear leopard print and go as a leopard!
To be a flapper girl, you just need a fringed dress or a fringed kimono with a simple dress,
some pearls, and a low updo if your hair is long!
To be a painter, you just need an apron splattered with paint, a paint brush, and an empty paint
bucket as your purse or candy bag!
For a scarecrow, just wear the same outfit as you would for the cowgirl costume, and
add a bandana to your neck, and corn husks or straw in your boots and sleeves!
To be a princess, just wear your prettiest fancy outfit, add a tiara, and that's it!
For a witch, all you need is a black outfit, and a witch hat!
To be Tris from Divergent, you just need an all-black outfit with a pair of combat boots!
To transform yourself into a vintage movie star, just wear your favorite fancy dress,
a faux fur coat or cloak if you have one, pearls, and your biggest sunglasses!
For Pippi longstockings, just put together your craziest outfit, and pair it with some
striped socks and boots, then put your hair into 2 braids, and stick wires through them
to make them curve upwards!
To be Regina George from Mean Girls, just cut two holes out of a tanktop, and wear it
with a preppy skirt, high heels, and a pony tail! This costume is perfect for anyone who
loves the movie Mean Girls!
To turn into a belly dancer, all you need is a bikini top, harem pants, sandals, and
gold jewelry!
For the girl from Finding Nemo, you just need a purple sweater, a white colored shirt to
wear underneath, shorts or a skirt, a bag with a fake fish if you want, and a wire wrapped
from ear to ear like her braces headgear!
If you're a dancer like me, a ballerina is a perfect last minute costume for you! Just
wear your favorite leotard, pink tights, a tutu, legwarmers, put your hair up into a
ballet bun, and I would suggest wearing ballet flat street shoes instead of real dance shoes,
so your feet are comfortable, but if you want you, can carry around a pair of your old ballet
shoes!
To be a baby, all you need is your favorite pair of pjs, a teddy bear, and your hair in
pigtails or braids!
To be 50 shades of grey, you can either wear all your grey clothes, or you can tape or
string together grey paint chips into a dress, a top, or a whole outfit!
To be a classic Vampire for Halloween, you just need a black outfit, a cloak or cape
if you have one, red accessories and lipstick, and fake blood or fangs if you want.
To be the fabulous Miranda Sings, you'll need a pair of red sweatpants, a men's dress shirt,
and of course the classic red lipstick!
To turn into a Greek goddess, you just need a piece of fabric long enough to wrap around
your body 1 1/2 times, and then wrap it around your body and secure it with a belt, and you'll
have a super easy toga-like costume!
This last idea is perfect if you have literally no time to put together a costume because
all you do is write "Error 404: Costume not found" on a plain shirt, and then you can
wear it with whatever else you want!
So that's it for this video, I really hope you guys enjoyed, and if you did, don't forget
to click right over here so that you can subscribe and receive an alert whenever I upload a new
video! I hope you guys enjoyed this video, and I will talk to you next time! Bye!
